name: nfaov
params: setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2

stmt.origin: nfcxfr(s0, caov(c0, c1, c2), cafv(c1, cop(c0, c2)))

body.origin:
|- wnfc(s0, caov(c0, c1, c2))
-| wceq(caov(c0, c1, c2), cafv(c1, cop(c0, c2)))
-| wnfc(s0, cafv(c1, cop(c0, c2)))

cumulated.origin:
|- wnfc(s0, caov(c0, c1, c2))
-| wceq(caov(c0, c1, c2), cafv(c1, cop(c0, c2)))
-| wnfc(s0, cafv(c1, cop(c0, c2)))

body.origin: |- wceq(caov(c0, c1, c2), cafv(c1, cop(c0, c2)))

cumulated.origin:
|- wnfc(s0, caov(c0, c1, c2))
-| wnfc(s0, cafv(c1, cop(c0, c2)))

body.origin:
|- wnfc(s0, cafv(c1, cop(c0, c2)))
-| wnfc(s0, c1)
-| wnfc(s0, cop(c0, c2))

cumulated.origin:
|- wnfc(s0, caov(c0, c1, c2))
-| wnfc(s0, c1)
-| wnfc(s0, cop(c0, c2))

body.origin:
|- wnfc(s0, cop(c0, c2))
-| wnfc(s0, c0)
-| wnfc(s0, c2)

cumulated.origin:
|- wnfc(s0, caov(c0, c1, c2))
-| wnfc(s0, c1)
-| wnfc(s0, c0)
-| wnfc(s0, c2)

comment: Bound-variable hypothesis builder for operation value, analogous to ~ nfov . To prove a deduction version of this analogous to ~ nfovd is not quickly possible because many deduction versions for bound-variable hypothesis builder for constructs the definition of alternative operation values is based on are not available (see ~ nfafv ). (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 26-May-2017.)
